level.text: A beneficial interest in a statutory trust is personal property.
A beneficial interest in a statutory trust shall not be an interest in specific property of the statutory trust.
A beneficial owner shall not have a preemptive right to subscribe to any additional issue of beneficial interests or any other interest of a statutory trust.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 repealed former (a); redesignated former "(b) through (d) as (a) through (c); and substituted ""is personal property" for ""shall be personal property regardless of the nature of the property of the trust" in (a).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 601 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
Section 2(l)(7)(A) of D.C. Law 19-210 substituted "Beneficial Owners" for "Beneficiaries and Beneficial Rights" in the subchapter heading.
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
